content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a simple implementation of your request in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all Julia code blocks
    blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seed=1))
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
    code_str = join([replace(block.captures[1], r"^```julia\n|```$"=>"") for block in blocks], "\n\n")
    
    return code_str
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all Julia code blocks in the markdown document and then removes the code fences from each block. The resulting strings are joined together with a newline character, creating one long string of Julia code. 

Please note that this function assumes that there is only one language specified for each code block (i.e., ```julia). If you have multiple languages in your markdown document and want to extract all of them, you would need to modify the regular expression accordingly.
